summary.span: 提供 类的 HTTP 特定的实现。

span.span: Provides an HTTP-specific implementation of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 建议不要将 `HttpWebRequest` 用于新的开发。We don't recommend that you use `HttpWebRequest` for new development. 请改用 类。Instead, use the class. 类为 中定义的属性和方法提供支持，并提供其他属性和方法，使用户能够使用 HTTP 直接与服务器交互。The class provides support for the properties and methods defined in and for additional properties and methods that enable the user to interact directly with servers using HTTP. 不要使用 构造函数。Do not use the constructor. 使用 方法来初始化新的 对象。Use the method to initialize new objects. 如果统一资源标识符（URI）的方案为 `http://` 或 `https://`，则 返回 对象。If the scheme for the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is `http://` or `https://`, returns an object. 方法对 属性中指定的资源进行同步请求，并返回包含响应对象的 。The method makes a synchronous request to the resource specified in the property and returns an that contains the response object. 可以使用 返回的流接收响应数据。The response data can be received by using the stream returned by . 如果响应对象或响应流已关闭，则将作废剩余数据。If the response object or the response stream is closed, remaining data will be forfeited. 如果满足以下条件，则剩余的数据将被释放，并且在关闭响应对象或流时，套接字将重新用于后续请求：这是一个 keep-alive 或流水线请求，只需收到少量的数据，或在较短的时间间隔内接收剩余数据。The remaining data will be drained and the socket will be re-used for subsequent requests when closing the response object or stream if the following conditions hold: it's a keep-alive or pipelined request, only a small amount of data needs to be received, or the remaining data is received in a small time interval. 如果未满足上述条件，则将关闭套接字。If none of the mentioned conditions hold or the drain time is exceeded, the socket will be closed. 对于 keep-alive 连接或管线连接，强烈建议应用程序读取流直到 EOF。For keep-alive or pipelined connections, we strongly recommend that the application reads the streams until EOF. 这可确保在后续请求中重复使用套接字，从而提高性能并减少使用的资源。This ensures that the socket will be re-used for subsequent requests resulting in better performance and less resources used. 若要将数据发送到资源， 方法返回一个用于发送数据的 对象。When you want to send data to the resource, the method returns a object to use to send data. 和 方法提供对发送数据流的异步访问。The and methods provide asynchronous access to the send data stream. 对于 的客户端身份验证，客户端证书必须安装在当前用户的 "我的证书存储" 中。For client authentication with , the client certificate must be installed in the My certificate store of the current user. 当访问资源的过程中出现错误时， 类将引发 。The class throws a when errors occur while accessing a resource. 属性包含一个 值，该值指示错误的源。The property contains a value that indicates the source of the error. 时， 属性包含从资源接收的 。When is , the property contains the received from the resource. 公开作为属性、由方法设置或由系统设置的发送到 Internet 资源的常见 HTTP 标头值;下表包含一个完整的列表。 exposes common HTTP header values sent to the Internet resource as properties, set by methods, or set by the system; the following table contains a complete list. 可以将 属性中的其他标头设置为名称/值对。You can set other headers in the property as name/value pairs. 请注意，在请求期间服务器和缓存可能会更改或添加标头。Note that servers and caches may change or add headers during the request. 下表列出了由属性或方法或系统设置的 HTTP 标头。The following table lists the HTTP headers that are set either by properties or methods or the system. |标头Header|设置者Set by| |------------|------------| |接受Accept|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |连接Connection| 属性设置， 属性。Set by the property, property.| |Content-lengthContent-Length|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |Content-TypeContent-Type|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |ExpectExpect|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |日期Date|由系统设置为当前日期。Set by the system to current date.| |HostHost|由系统设置为当前主机信息。Set by the system to current host information.| |If-Modified-SinceIf-Modified-Since|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |范围Range|由 方法设置。Set by the method.| |RefererReferer|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |传输编码Transfer-Encoding|由 属性设置（ 属性必须 `true`）。Set by the property (the property must be `true`).| |User-AgentUser-Agent|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| > [!NOTE] > 自动注册 。 is registered automatically. 不需要调用 方法来注册 ，然后才能使用以 `http://` 或 `https://`开头的 Uri。You do not need to call the method to register before using URIs beginning with `http://` or `https://`. 本地计算机或应用程序配置文件可以指定使用默认代理。The local computer or application config file may specify that a default proxy be used. 如果指定 属性，则 属性中的代理设置将覆盖本地计算机或应用程序配置文件， 实例将使用指定的代理设置。If the property is specified, then the proxy settings from the property override the local computer or application config file and the instance will use the proxy settings specified. 如果未在配置文件中指定代理，并且未指定 属性，则 类将使用从本地计算机上的 Internet Explorer 继承的代理设置。If no proxy is specified in a config file and the property is unspecified, the class uses the proxy settings inherited from Internet Explorer on the local computer. 如果 Internet Explorer 中没有代理设置，请求将直接发送到服务器。If there are no proxy settings in Internet Explorer, the request is sent directly to the server. 类分析一个代理跳过列表，其中包含从 Internet Explorer 继承的通配符字符，而不是由 Internet Explorer 直接分析绕过列表。The class parses a proxy bypass list with wildcard characters inherited from Internet Explorer differently than the bypass list is parsed directly by Internet Explorer. 例如， 类会将 Internet Explorer 中的 "nt \*" 跳过列表分析为 "nt. $" 的正则表达式。For example, the class will parse a bypass list of "nt\*" from Internet Explorer as a regular expression of "nt.$". 这与 Internet Explorer 的本机行为不同。This differs from the native behavior of Internet Explorer. 因此，URL "`http://intxxxxx`" 会绕过代理使用 类，但不会使用 Internet Explorer 来绕过代理。So a URL of "`http://intxxxxx`" would bypass the proxy using the class, but would not bypass the proxy using Internet Explorer. > [!NOTE] > 框架在创建时将缓存 SSL 会话，并在可能的情况下尝试重复使用缓存会话来执行新请求。The Framework caches SSL sessions as they are created and attempts to reuse a cached session for a new request, if possible. 尝试重复使用 SSL 会话时，框架使用 的第一个元素（如果有），或在 为空时尝试重用匿名会话。When attempting to reuse an SSL session, the Framework uses the first element of (if there is one), or tries to reuse an anonymous sessions if is empty. > [!NOTE] > 出于安全考虑，默认情况下会禁用 cookie。For security reasons, cookies are disabled by default. 如果要使用 cookie，请使用 属性启用 cookie。If you want to use cookies, use the property to enable cookies. 4.6 .NET Framework 包括一项新的安全功能，用于阻止连接的不安全密码和哈希算法。The .NET Framework 4.6 includes a new security feature that blocks insecure cipher and hashing algorithms for connections. 默认情况下，通过 Api 使用 TLS/SSL （如 HttpClient、HttpWebRequest、FTPClient、System.net.mail.smtpclient、System.net.security.sslstream 等）和目标 .NET Framework 4.6 获取更安全的行为。Applications using TLS/SSL through APIs such as HttpClient, HttpWebRequest, FTPClient, SmtpClient, SslStream, etc. and targeting .NET Framework 4.6 get the more-secure behavior by default. 开发人员可能需要选择退出此行为，以便与现有的 SSL3 服务或具有 RC4 服务的 TLS 保持互操作性。Developers may want to opt out of this behavior in order to maintain interoperability with their existing SSL3 services OR TLS w/ RC4 services. [本文](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3069494)介绍如何修改代码，以便禁用新行为。[This article](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3069494) explains how to modify your code so that the new behavior is disabled. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建 URI `http://www.contoso.com/`的 。The following code example creates an for the URI `http://www.contoso.com/`. [!code-cpp[Classic HttpWebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic HttpWebRequest Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic HttpWebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic HttpWebRequest Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic HttpWebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic HttpWebRequest Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 取消向 Internet 资源发出的请求。

span.span: Cancels a request to an Internet resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法取消对资源的请求。The method cancels a request to a resource. 取消请求后，调用 、、、、或 方法将导致 属性设置为 的 。After a request is canceled, calling the , , , , , or method causes a with the property set to . 如果在这两个操作均未完成的情况下调用 方法， 方法将同步执行为 或 方法指定的回调。The method will synchronously execute the callback specified to the or methods if the method is called while either of these operations are outstanding. 这可能会导致潜在的死锁问题。This can lead to potential deadlock issues. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[网络跟踪](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e993b7c3-087f-45d8-9c02-9dded936d804)。For more information, see [Network Tracing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e993b7c3-087f-45d8-9c02-9dded936d804). ## Examples 对于异步请求，客户端应用程序负责实现自己的超时机制。In the case of asynchronous requests, it is the responsibility of the client application to implement its own time-out mechanism. 下面的代码示例演示如何执行此操作。The following code example shows how to do this. [!code-cpp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.BeginGetResponse#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.HttpWebRequest.BeginGetResponse/CPP/begingetresponse.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.BeginGetResponse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.HttpWebRequest.BeginGetResponse/CS/begingetresponse.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.BeginGetResponse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.HttpWebRequest.BeginGetResponse/VB/begingetresponse.vb#1)]

summary.span: 向请求添加范围标头。

span.span: Adds a range header to the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 由于所有 HTTP 实体都在 HTTP 消息中表示为字节序列，因此字节范围的概念对于任何 HTTP 实体都是有意义的。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并不是所有的客户端和服务器都需要支持字节范围的操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求上的 Range 标头允许客户端请求仅接收 HTTP 实体中指定范围内的某个部分。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests.

summary.span: 向请求添加从请求数据的开始处或结束处的特定范围的字节范围标头。

span.span: Adds a byte range header to a request for a specific range from the beginning or end of the requested data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法向请求添加一个字节范围标头。The method adds a byte range header to the request. 如果 `range` 为正，则 `range` 参数将指定范围的起始点。If `range` is positive, the `range` parameter specifies the starting point of the range. 服务器应该开始从指定的 `range` 参数向 HTTP 实体中数据的末尾发送数据。The server should start sending data from the `range` parameter specified to the end of the data in the HTTP entity. 如果 `range` 为负数，则 `range` 参数将指定范围的结束点。If `range` is negative, the `range` parameter specifies the ending point of the range. 服务器应该开始将数据从 HTTP 实体中的数据开始发送到指定的 `range` 参数。The server should start sending data from the start of the data in the HTTP entity to the `range` parameter specified. 由于所有 HTTP 实体都在 HTTP 消息中表示为字节序列，因此字节范围的概念对于任何 HTTP 实体都是有意义的。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并不是所有的客户端和服务器都需要支持字节范围的操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求上的 Range 标头允许客户端请求仅接收 HTTP 实体中指定范围内的某个部分。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests. HTTP 协议请求中的范围标头示例请求服务器发送前100个字节（从开始到字节位置99），如下所示：An example of a Range header in an HTTP protocol request that requests the server send the first 100 bytes (from the start to byte position 99) would be the following: `Range: bytes=0-99\r\n\r\n` 对于本示例，`range` 参数将是-99。For this example, the `range` parameter would be -99. HTTP 服务器指示支持范围标头和接受范围标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header. 支持字节范围的服务器的接受范围标头示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` 如果服务器的响应标头中未收到 Accept 范围的标头，则服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 不支持范围但可识别接受范围标头的服务器的 Accept 范围标头的示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 接收范围请求的响应时，只会分析与整个请求关联的 HTTP 标头，并通过 类的属性使其可供使用。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 与每个范围关联的标头将在响应中返回。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response. ## Examples 下面的代码示例向请求添加范围标头。The following code example adds a range header to the request. [!code-cpp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange/vb/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法向请求添加一个字节范围标头。The method adds a byte range header to the request. 如果 `range` 为正，则 `range` 参数将指定范围的起始点。If `range` is positive, the `range` parameter specifies the starting point of the range. 服务器应该开始从指定的 `range` 参数向 HTTP 实体中数据的末尾发送数据。The server should start sending data from the `range` parameter specified to the end of the data in the HTTP entity. 如果 `range` 为负数，则 `range` 参数将指定范围的结束点。If `range` is negative, the `range` parameter specifies the ending point of the range. 服务器应该开始将数据从 HTTP 实体中的数据开始发送到指定的 `range` 参数。The server should start sending data from the start of the data in the HTTP entity to the `range` parameter specified. 由于所有 HTTP 实体都在 HTTP 消息中表示为字节序列，因此字节范围的概念对于任何 HTTP 实体都是有意义的。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并不是所有的客户端和服务器都需要支持字节范围的操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求上的 Range 标头允许客户端请求仅接收 HTTP 实体中指定范围内的某个部分。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests. HTTP 协议请求中的范围标头示例请求服务器发送前100个字节（从开始到字节位置99），如下所示：An example of a Range header in an HTTP protocol request that requests the server send the first 100 bytes (from the start to byte position 99) would be the following: `Range: bytes=0-99\r\n\r\n` 对于本示例，`range` 参数将是-99。For this example, the `range` parameter would be -99. HTTP 服务器指示支持范围标头和接受范围标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header. 支持字节范围的服务器的接受范围标头示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` 如果服务器的响应标头中未收到 Accept 范围的标头，则服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 不支持范围但可识别接受范围标头的服务器的 Accept 范围标头的示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 接收范围请求的响应时，只会分析与整个请求关联的 HTTP 标头，并通过 类的属性使其可供使用。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 与每个范围关联的标头将在响应中返回。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response.

summary.span: 向请求添加指定范围的字节范围标头。

span.span: Adds a byte range header to the request for a specified range.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法向请求添加一个字节范围标头。The method adds a byte range header to the request. 由于所有 HTTP 实体都在 HTTP 消息中表示为字节序列，因此字节范围的概念对于任何 HTTP 实体都是有意义的。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并不是所有的客户端和服务器都需要支持字节范围的操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求上的 Range 标头允许客户端请求仅接收 HTTP 实体中指定范围内的某个部分。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests. 请求前100个字节的 HTTP 协议请求中的范围标头示例如下：An example of a Range header in an HTTP protocol request that requests the first 100 bytes would be would be the following: `Range: bytes=0-99\r\n\r\n` 对于本示例，`from` 参数将指定为0，并且 `to` 参数将指定为99。For this example, the `from` parameter would be specified as 0 and the `to` parameter would be specified as 99. 此方法自动将范围说明符设置为 "bytes"。The range specifier is automatically set as "bytes" by this method. HTTP 服务器指示支持范围标头和接受范围标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header. 支持字节范围的服务器的接受范围标头示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` 如果服务器的响应标头中未收到 Accept 范围的标头，则服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 不支持范围但可识别接受范围标头的服务器的 Accept 范围标头的示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 接收范围请求的响应时，只会分析与整个请求关联的 HTTP 标头，并通过 类的属性使其可供使用。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 与每个范围关联的标头将在响应中返回。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response. ## Examples 下面的代码示例向请求添加范围标头。The following code example adds a range header to the request. [!code-cpp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange2/cpp/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange2/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Net.HttpWebRequest.AddRange2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/system.net.httpwebrequest.addrange2/vb/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法向请求添加范围标头。The method adds a Range header to the request. 如果 `range` 为正，则 `range` 参数将指定范围的起始点。If `range` is positive, the `range` parameter specifies the starting point of span.span: Adds a range header to a request for a specified range.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法向请求添加范围标头。The method adds a Range header to the request. 由于所有 HTTP 实体都在 HTTP 消息中表示为字节序列，因此字节范围的概念对于任何 HTTP 实体都是有意义的。Since all HTTP entities are represented in HTTP messages as sequences of bytes, the concept of a byte range is meaningful for any HTTP entity. 但是，并不是所有的客户端和服务器都需要支持字节范围的操作。However, not all clients and servers need to support byte-range operations. 请求上的 Range 标头允许客户端请求仅接收 HTTP 实体中指定范围内的某个部分。The Range header on a request allows a client to request that it only wants to receive some part of the specified range of bytes in an HTTP entity. 服务器不需要支持范围标头请求。Servers are not required to support Range header requests. `rangeSpecifier` 参数通常指定为 "bytes"，因为这是大多数 HTTP 服务器识别的唯一范围说明符。The `rangeSpecifier` parameter would normally be specified as a "bytes", since this is the only range specifier recognized by most HTTP servers. 将 `rangeSpecifier` 参数设置为其他某个字符串可支持除字节（在 RFC 2616 中由 IETF 定义的字节范围说明符）以外的自定义范围说明符。Setting the `rangeSpecifier` parameter to some other string allows support for custom range specifiers other than bytes (the byte-range specifier defined in RFC 2616 by the IETF). 请求前100个字节的 HTTP 协议请求中的范围标头示例如下：An example of a Range header in an HTTP protocol request that requests the first 100 bytes would be would be the following: `Range: bytes=0-99\r\n\r\n` 对于本示例，`rangeSpecifier` 参数将指定为 "bytes"，`from` 参数将为0，`to` 参数将为99。For this example, the `rangeSpecifier` parameter would be specified as a "bytes", the `from` parameter would be 0, and the `to` parameter would be 99. HTTP 服务器指示对范围标头的支持在响应中包含 Accept 范围标头。A HTTP server indicates support for Range headers with the Accept-Ranges header in the response. 支持字节范围的服务器的接受范围标头示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that supports byte-ranges would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: bytes\r\n\r\n` 在接受范围标头中指定的字符串为范围说明符，该说明符是在此方法的 `rangeSpecifier` 参数中指定的。The string specified in the Accept-Ranges header is the range-specifier that would be by specified in the `rangeSpecifier` parameter for this method. 如果服务器的响应标头中未收到 Accept 范围的标头，则服务器不支持范围标头。If an Accept-Ranges header is not received in the header of the response from the server, then the server does not support Range headers. 不支持范围但可识别接受范围标头的服务器的 Accept 范围标头的示例如下所示：An example of the Accept-Ranges header from a server that does not support ranges, but recognizes the Accept-Ranges header, would be as follows: `Accept-Ranges: none\r\n\r\n` 接收范围请求的响应时，只会分析与整个请求关联的 HTTP 标头，并通过 类的属性使其可供使用。When receiving the response from a range request, only the HTTP headers associated with the entire request are parsed and made available via properties on the class. 与每个范围关联的标头将在响应中返回。Headers associated with each range are returned in the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请求完成期间发生的任何重定向后， 属性设置为 URI。The property is set to the URI after any redirections that happen during the request are complete. 原始请求的 URI 保存在 属性中。The URI of the original request is kept in the property. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将检查 对象是否 `req` 重定向到另一个位置以实现请求，并将 `hasChanged` 变量的值设置为在请求被重定向时 `true`。否则 `hasChanged` 设置为 `false`。The following code example checks to see if the object `req` was redirected to another location to fulfill the request, and sets the value of the `hasChanged` variable to `true` if the request was redirected; otherwise `hasChanged` is set to `false`. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示请求是否应跟随重定向响应。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the request should follow redirection responses.

value.span: 如果请求应自动遵循来自 Internet 资源的重定向响应，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the request should automatically follow redirection responses from the Internet resource; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果希望请求自动跟随 HTTP 重定向标头到资源的新位置，请将 设置为 `true`。Set to `true` if you want the request to automatically follow HTTP redirection headers to the new location of the resource. 要遵循的重定向的最大数目由 属性设置。The maximum number of redirections to follow is set by the property. 如果 设置为 `false`，则会将具有 HTTP 状态代码 399 300 的所有响应返回到应用程序。If is set to `false`, all responses with an HTTP status code from 300 to 399 is returned to the application. 自动重定向会清除授权标头，并 自动尝试重新进行重定向到重定向的位置。The Authorization header is cleared on auto-redirects and automatically tries to re-authenticate to the redirected location. 在实践中，这意味着应用程序无法将自定义身份验证信息放入授权标头（如果可能遇到重定向）。In practice, this means that an application can't put custom authentication information into the Authorization header if it is possible to encounter redirection. 相反，应用程序必须实现并注册自定义身份验证模块。Instead, the application must implement and register a custom authentication module. 和相关类用于实现自定义身份验证模块。The and related class are used to implement a custom authentication module. 方法注册自定义身份验证模块。The method registers a custom authentication module. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 属性允许请求跟随重定向响应。The following code example uses the property to allow the request to follow redirection responses. [!code-cpp[HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect/CPP/httpwebrequest_allowautoredirect.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect/CS/httpwebrequest_allowautoredirect.cs#2)] [!code-vb[HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_AllowAutoRedirect/VB/httpwebrequest_allowautoredirect.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将启动一个用于发送 的数据的流的异步请求。The method starts an asynchronous request for a stream used to send data for the . 异步回调方法使用 方法返回实际流。The asynchronous callback method uses the method to return the actual stream. 在此方法成为异步之前， 方法需要完成一些同步安装任务（例如，DNS 解析、代理检测和 TCP 套接字连接）。The method requires some synchronous setup tasks to complete (DNS resolution, proxy detection, and TCP socket connection, for example) before this method becomes asynchronous. 因此，永远不应在用户界面（UI）线程上调用此方法，因为它可能需要很长时间（取决于网络设置），以便在引发错误之前完成初始同步设置任务或方法成功。As a result, this method should never be called on a user interface (UI) thread because it might take considerable time (up to several minutes depending on network settings) to complete the initial synchronous setup tasks before an exception for an error is thrown or the method succeeds. 若要了解有关线程池的详细信息，请参阅[托管线程池](~/docs/standard/threading/the-managed-thread-pool.md)。To learn more about the thread pool, see [The managed thread pool](~/docs/standard/threading/the-managed-thread-pool.md). > [!NOTE] > 应用程序不能为特定请求混合使用同步和异步方法。Your application cannot mix synchronous and asynchronous methods for a particular request. 如果调用 方法，则必须使用 方法来检索响应。If you call the method, you must use the method to retrieve the response. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 方法发出对流实例的异步请求。The following code example uses the method to make an asynchronous request for a stream instance. [!code-cpp[HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream/CPP/httpwebrequest_begingetrequeststream.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream/CS/httpwebrequest_begingetrequeststream.cs#2)] [!code-vb[HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebRequest_BeginGetRequestStream/VB/httpwebrequest_begingetrequeststream.vb#2)]

method to return the actual . 如果在 类上设置的属性冲突，则在若干情况下会引发 。A is thrown in several cases when the properties set on the class are conflicting. 如果应用程序将 属性和 属性设置为 `true`，然后发送 HTTP GET 请求，则会发生此异常。This exception occurs if an application sets the property and the property to `true`, and then sends an HTTP GET request. 如果应用程序尝试将分块发送到仅支持 HTTP 1.0 协议（不支持此协议）的服务器，则会发生此异常。This exception occurs if an application tries to send chunked to a server that only supports HTTP 1.0 protocol, where this is not supported. 如果应用程序尝试在不设置 属性的情况下发送数据，`false` 或在停用连接上禁用了缓冲并在 keepalive 连接上（ 属性为 `true`），则会发生此异常`.`This exception occurs if an application tries to send data without setting the property or the is `false` when buffering is disabled and on a keepalive connection (the property is `true`)`.` 如果引发了 ，请使用异常的 和 属性来确定来自服务器的响应。If a is thrown, use the and properties of the exception to determine the response from the server. 在此方法成为异步之前， 方法需要完成一些同步安装任务（例如，DNS 解析、代理检测和 TCP 套接字连接）。The method requires some synchronous setup tasks to complete (DNS resolution, proxy detection, and TCP socket connection, for example) before this method becomes asynchronous. 因此，永远不应在用户界面（UI）线程上调用此方法，因为它可能需要很长时间（取决于网络设置），以便在引发错误之前完成初始同步设置任务或方法成功。As a result, this method should never be called on a user interface (UI) thread because it might take considerable time (up to several minutes depending on network settings) to complete the initial synchronous setup tasks before an exception for an error is thrown or the method succeeds. 若要了解有关线程池的详细信息，请参阅[托管线程池](~/docs/standard/threading/the-managed-thread-pool.md)。To learn more about the thread pool, see [The managed thread pool](~/docs/standard/threading/the-managed-thread-pool.md). > [!NOTE] > 应用程序不能为特定请求混合使用同步和异步方法。Your application cannot mix synchronous and asynchronous methods for a particular request. 如果调用 方法，则必须使用 方法来检索响应。If you call the method, you must use the method to retrieve the response. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 方法发出对 Internet 资源的异步请求。The following code example uses the method to make an asynchronous request for an Internet resource. > [!NOTE] > 对于异步请求，客户端应用程序负责实现自己的超时机制。In the case of asynchronous requests, it is the responsibility of the client application to implement its own time-out mechanism. remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以将证书添加到集合，但可能不具有对它的访问权限。An application can add a certificate to a collection, but might not have access rights to it. 若要使用集合中包含的证书，应用程序必须具有与颁发证书的实体相同的访问权限。To use a certificate contained in the collection, the application must have the same access rights as the entity that issued the certificate. > [!NOTE] > 框架在创建时将缓存 SSL 会话，并在可能的情况下尝试重复使用缓存会话来执行新请求。The Framework caches SSL sessions as they are created and attempts to reuse a cached session for a new request, if possible. 尝试重复使用 SSL 会话时，框架使用 的第一个元素（如果有），或在 为空时尝试重用匿名会话。When attempting to reuse an SSL session, the Framework uses the first element of (if there is one), or tries to reuse an anonymous sessions if is empty. > [!NOTE] > 出于性能原因，您不应将客户端证书添加到 ，除非您知道服务器会询问该证书。For performance reasons, you shouldn't add a client certificate to a unless you know the server will ask for it. > > 有关演示如何枚举客户端证书存储区中的证书的代码示例，请参阅 类。For a code example illustrating how to enumerate the certificates in the client certificate store, see the class.

span.span: An that contains the authentication credentials associated with the request.

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性包含标识请求制造商的身份验证信息。The property contains authentication information to identify the maker of the request. 属性可以是 ，在这种情况下， 对象中包含的用户、密码和域信息可用于对 请求进行身份验证，在这种情况下，请求的统一资源标识符（URI）用于确定用于对请求进行身份验证的用户、密码和域信息。The property can be either a , in which case the user, password, and domain information contained in the object is used to authenticate the request, or it can be a , in which case the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the request is used to determine the user, password, and domain information to use to authenticate the request. 在大多数客户端方案中，应使用 属性，其中包含当前登录的用户的凭据。In most client scenarios, you should use the property, which contains the credentials of the currently logged on user. 为此，请将 属性设置为 `true`，而不是设置此属性。To do this, set the property to `true` instead of setting this property. 如果在中间层应用程序中使用 类（如 ASP.NET 应用程序），则 属性中的凭据属于运行 ASP 页（服务器端凭据）的帐户。If the class is being used in a middle-tier application, such as an ASP.NET application, the credentials in the property belong to the account running the ASP page (the server-side credentials). 通常情况下，会将此属性设置为代表其发出请求的客户端的凭据。Typically, you would set this property to the credentials of the client on whose behalf the request is made. > [!NOTE] > NTLM 身份验证方案不能用于模拟其他用户。The NTLM authentication scheme cannot be used to impersonate another user. 必须将 Kerberos 专门配置为支持模拟。Kerberos must be specially configured to support impersonation. 若要将 HttpWebRequest 限制为一个或多个身份验证方法，请使用 类，并将凭据绑定到一个或多个身份验证方案To restrict HttpWebRequest to one or more authentication methods, use the class and bind your credentials to one or more authentication schemes 支持的身份验证方案包括摘要式、Negotiate、Kerberos、NTLM 和 Basic。Supported authentication schemes include Digest, Negotiate, Kerberos, NTLM, and Basic. 出于安全原因，在自动重定向后，请存储要在 中包含的凭据，并将其分配给此属性。For security reasons, when automatically following redirects, store the credentials that you want to be included in the redirect in a and assign it to this property. 如果重定向包含除 之外的任何内容，则此属性将自动设置为 `null` 重定向。This property will automatically be set to `null` upon redirection if it contains anything except a . 在这些条件下，将此属性值自动设置为 `null` 会阻止将凭据发送到任何意外的目标。Having this property value be automatically set to `null` under those conditions prevents credentials from being sent to any unintended destination. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置请求的凭据。The following code example sets the credentials for a request. [!code-cpp[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/CPP/httpwebrequest1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/CS/httpwebrequest1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[NCLResponse1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLResponse1/VB/httpwebrequest1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设置此属性将为 HTTP 和 HTTPS 方案注册指定的策略。Setting this property registers the specified policy for the HTTP and HTTPS schemes. 此策略在以下情况下用于此请求：This policy is used for this request if: 没有为此请求指定 属性。There is no property specified for this request. - 或 --or- 计算机和应用程序配置文件不指定适用于用于创建此请求的统一资源标识符（URI）的缓存策略。The machine and application configuration files do not specify a cache policy that is applicable to the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) used to create this request. 缓存策略确定是否可以从缓存中获取请求的资源，而不是将请求发送到资源主机计算机。The cache policy determines whether the requested resource can be taken from a cache instead of sending the request to the resource host computer. 如果资源的响应流已检索并读取到流的末尾，则仅将资源的副本添加到缓存中。A copy of a resource is only added to the cache if the response stream for the resource is retrieved and read to the end of the stream. 因此，对同一资源的另一请求可能会使用缓存的副本，具体取决于此请求的缓存策略级别。So another request for the same resource could use a cached copy, depending on the cache policy level for this request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 响应标头的长度接收到响应状态行和作为 HTTP 协议的一部分接收的任何额外控制字符。The length of the response header received the response status line and any extra control characters that are received as part of HTTP protocol. 如果值为-1，则表示未对接收的响应标头施加限制;如果值为0，则表示所有请求都将失败。A value of -1 means no limit is imposed on the response headers received; a value of 0 means that all requests fail. 还可以在配置文件中更改此值。This value can also be changed in the configuration file. 可以通过在 类的实例上设置 属性来重写此属性的影响。The impact of this property can be overridden by setting the property on an instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成 方法启动的流的异步请求。The method completes an asynchronous request for a stream that was started by the method. 返回 对象之后，你可以使用 方法通过 发送数据。After the object has been returned, you can send data with the by using the method. > [!NOTE] > 在将数据写入流之前，必须设置 属性的值。You must set the value of the property before writing data to the stream. > [!CAUTION] > 必须调用 方法来关闭流并释放连接以供重用。You must call the method to close the stream and release the connection for reuse. 未能关闭流将导致应用程序无法连接。Failure to close the stream causes your application to run out of connections. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 方法结束对流实例的异步请求。The following code example uses the method to end an asynchronous request for a stream instance. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成 方法启动的流的异步请求，并输出与该流关联的 。The method completes an asynchronous request for a stream that was started by the method and outputs the associated with the stream. 返回 对象之后，你可以使用 方法通过 发送数据。After the object has been returned, you can send data with the by using the method. 某些使用具有扩展保护的集成 Windows 身份验证的应用程序可能需要能够查询 使用的传输层，以便从基础 TLS 通道检索通道绑定令牌（CBT）。Some applications that use integrated Windows authentication with extended protection may need to be able to query the transport layer used by in order to retrieve the channel binding token (CBT) from the underlying TLS channel. 方法为具有请求正文的 HTTP 方法（`POST` 和 `PUT` 请求）提供对此信息的访问。The method provides access to this information for HTTP methods which have a request body (`POST` and `PUT` requests). 仅当应用程序要实现其自己的身份验证并需要访问 CBT 时，才需要此权限。This is only needed if the application is implementing its own authentication and needs access to the CBT. > [!NOTE] > 如果应用程序需要设置 属性的值，则必须在检索流并向其写入数据之前完成此操作。If an application needs to set the value of the property, then this must be done before retrieving the stream and writing data to it. > [!CAUTION] > 必须调用 方法来关闭流并释放连接以供重用。You must call the method to close the stream and release the connection for reuse. 未能关闭流将导致应用程序无法连接。Failure to close the stream causes your application to run out of connections. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

span.span: Returns a response from an Internet resource.

span.span: A that contains the response from the Internet resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法返回包含来自 Internet 资源的响应的 对象。The method returns a object that contains the response from the Internet resource. 返回的实际实例是一个 ，可转换到该类以访问特定于 HTTP 的属性。The actual instance returned is an , and can be typecast to that class to access HTTP-specific properties. 如果在 类上设置的属性冲突，则在若干情况下会引发 。A is thrown in several cases when the properties set on the class are conflicting. 如果应用程序将 属性和 属性设置为 `true`，然后发送 HTTP GET 请求，则会发生此异常。This exception occurs if an application sets the property and the property to `true`, and then sends an HTTP GET request. 如果应用程序尝试将分块发送到仅支持 HTTP 1.0 协议（不支持此协议）的服务器，则会发生此异常。This exception occurs if an application tries to send chunked to a server that only supports HTTP 1.0 protocol, where this is not supported. 如果应用程序尝试在不设置 属性的情况下发送数据，`false` 或在停用连接上禁用了缓冲并在 keepalive 连接上（ 属性为 `true`），则会发生此异常`.`This exception occurs if an application tries to send data without setting the property or the is `false` when buffering is disabled and on a keepalive connection (the property is `true`)`.` > [!CAUTION] > 必须调用 方法来关闭流并释放连接。You must call the method to close the stream and release the connection. 否则，可能会导致应用程序无法连接。Failure to do so may cause your application to run out of connections. 使用 POST 方法时，必须获取请求流，写入要发布的数据，并关闭流。When using the POST method, you must get the request stream, write the data to be posted, and close the stream. 此方法阻止等待内容发布;如果没有设置任何超时，且未提供内容，则调用线程会无限期阻止。This method blocks waiting for content to post; if there is no time-out set and you do not provide content, the calling thread blocks indefinitely. > [!NOTE] > 多次调用 返回相同的响应对象;不会重新颁发请求。Multiple calls to return the same response object; the request is not reissued. > [!NOTE] > 应用程序不能为特定请求混合使用同步和异步方法。Your application cannot mix synchronous and asynchronous methods for a particular request. 如果调用 方法，则必须使用 方法来检索响应。If you call the method, you must use the method to retrieve the response. > [!NOTE] > 如果引发了 ，请使用异常的 和 属性来确定来自服务器的响应。If a is thrown, use the and properties of the exception to determine the response from the server. > [!NOTE] > 当你在应用程序中启用网络跟踪后，此成员将输出跟踪信息。This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的网络跟踪](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md)。For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md). > [!NOTE] > 出于安全考虑，默认情况下会禁用 cookie。For security reasons, cookies are disabled by default. 如果要使用 cookie，请使用 属性启用 cookie。If you wish to use cookies, use the property to enable cookies. ## Examples 下面的代码示例获取请求的响应。The following code example gets the response for a request. remarks.format: ## Remarks 集合包含与请求关联的协议标头。The collection contains the protocol headers associated with the request. 下表列出了不存储在 集合中但由系统设置或由属性或方法设置的 HTTP 标头。The following table lists the HTTP headers that are not stored in the collection but are either set by the system or set by properties or methods. |标头Header|设置者Set by| |------------|------------| |接受Accept|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |连接Connection|由 属性和 属性设置。Set by the property and property.| |Content-lengthContent-Length|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |Content-TypeContent-Type|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |ExpectExpect|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |日期Date|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |HostHost|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |If-Modified-SinceIf-Modified-Since|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |范围Range|由 方法设置。Set by the method.| |RefererReferer|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| |传输编码Transfer-Encoding|由 属性设置（ 属性必须为 true）。Set by the property (the property must be true).| |User-AgentUser-Agent|由 属性设置。Set by the property.| 如果尝试设置其中一个受保护的标头， 方法将引发 。The method throws an if you try to set one of these protected headers. 通过调用 、、或 方法启动请求后，更改 属性会引发 。Changing the property after the request has been started by calling , , , or method throws an . 不应假定标头值保持不变，因为 Web 服务器和缓存可能会更改或向 Web 请求添加标头。You should not assume that the header values will remain unchanged, because Web servers and caches may change or add headers to a Web request. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 属性，将 HTTP 标头名称/值对打印到控制台。The following code example uses the property to print the HTTP header name/value pairs to the console. summary.span: 获取或设置要在 HTTP 请求中独立于请求 URI 使用的 Host 标头值。

span.span: Gets or sets the Host header value to use in an HTTP request independent from the request URI.

value.span: HTTP 请求中的 Host 标头值。

span.span: The Host header value in the HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性可用于设置要在 HTTP 请求中独立于请求 URI 使用的主机标头值。The property can be used to set the Host header value to use in an HTTP request independent from the request URI. 属性可以包括主机名和可选端口号。The property can consist of a hostname and an optional port number. 不带端口信息的主机标头表示请求的服务的默认端口（例如，HTTP URL 的端口80）。A Host header without port information implies the default port for the service requested (port 80 for an HTTP URL, for example). 指定主机和端口的格式必须遵循 IETF 发布的 RFC2616 14.23 节中的规则。The format for specifying a host and port must follow the rules in section 14.23 of RFC2616 published by the IETF. 符合这些要求的示例符合以下要求：指定端口8080将是 属性的以下值：An example complying with these requirements that specifies a port of 8080 would be the following value for the property: `www.contoso.com:8080` 使用 属性显式指定自定义主机标头值还会影响区域缓存、cookie 和身份验证。Using the property to explicitly specify a custom Host header value also affects areas caching, cookies, and authentication. 当应用程序提供特定 URI 前缀的凭据时，应用程序需要确保使用包含主机标头值的 URI，而不是 URI 中的目标服务器。When an application provides credentials for a specific URI prefix, the applications needs to make sure to use the URI containing the value of the Host header, not the target server in the URI. 缓存资源时使用的密钥使用主机标头值而不是请求 URI。The key used when caching resources, uses the Host header value rather than the request URI. Cookie 存储在 中，并按服务器域名进行逻辑分组。Cookies are stored in a and logically grouped by the server domain name. 如果应用程序指定主机标头，则此值将用作域。If the application specifies a Host header, then this value will be used as domain. 如果未设置 属性，则在 HTTP 请求中使用的主机标头值基于请求 URI。If the property is not set, then the Host header value to use in an HTTP request is based on the request URI.

exception.span: 无法将 Host 标头设置为 。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将此属性设置为 "`true`" 以发送 `Connection` HTTP 标头，并将值保持为活动状态。Set this property to `true` to send a `Connection` HTTP header with the value Keep-alive. 应用程序使用 指示持久性连接的首选项。An application uses to indicate a preference for persistent connections. 当 `true` 属性时，应用程序会与支持它们的服务器建立持久连接。When the property is `true`, the application makes persistent connections to the servers that support them. > [!NOTE] > 使用 HTTP/1.1 时，默认情况下，keep-alive 处于开启状态。When using HTTP/1.1, Keep-Alive is on by default. 将 设置为 `false` 可能会导致向服务器发送 `Connection: Close` 标头。Setting to `false` may result in sending a `Connection: Close` header to the server. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将 属性设置为 `false`，以避免与 Internet 资源建立持续连接。The following code example sets the property to `false` to avoid establishing a persistent connection with the Internet resource. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否随请求发送一个 Authorization 标头。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to send an Authorization header with the request.

value.span: 如果在发生身份验证之后随请求一起发送 HTTP Authorization 标头，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: to send an HTTP Authorization header with requests after authentication has taken place; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 成功对特定 的客户端请求进行身份验证后，如果 `true` 并且提供了凭据，则会将授权标头与每个请求一起发送到与特定 最多的 ，直到最后一个正斜杠。After a client request to a specific is successfully authenticated, if is `true` and credentials are supplied, the Authorization header is sent with each request to any that matches the specific up to the last forward slash. 因此，如果客户端请求成功地通过身份验证到了包含以下各项的特定 ：So if the client request successfully authenticated to a specific that contains the following: `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/` 然后，预身份验证的授权标头随每个请求发送到以下 实例：Then the Authorization header for preauthentication is sent with each request to any of the following instances: `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/default` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/default.html` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath/sample.html` 但是，授权标头不会随请求发送到以下任一 实例：However, the Authorization header is not sent with requests to any of the following instances: `http://www.contoso.com/` `http://www.contoso.com/firstpath` `http://www.contoso.com/secondpath/` 如果未成功对特定 的客户端请求进行身份验证，则该请求将使用标准身份验证过程。If the client request to a specific is not successfully authenticated, the request uses standard authentication procedures. 除第一个请求以外， 属性指示是否将身份验证信息与后续请求一起发送到与特定 匹配的 ，而无需等待服务器质询。With the exception of the first request, the property indicates whether to send authentication information with subsequent requests to a that matches the specific up to the last forward slash without waiting to be challenged by the server. 客户端和服务器之间的以下对话框说明了此属性的效果。The following dialog between client and server illustrates the effect of this property. 此对话框假定使用的是基本身份验证。The dialog assumes that basic authentication is in use. `false`： is `false`: 客户端：获取 someUrlClient: GET someUrl 服务器： 401 WWW-身份验证基本Server: 401 WWW-Authenticate Basic 客户端：获取授权标头Client: GET with Authorization headers 服务器：200正常Server: 200 OK 客户端：获取 someUrlClient: GET someUrl 服务器： 401 WWW-身份验证基本Server: 401 WWW-Authenticate Basic 客户端：获取授权标头Client: GET with Authorization headers 服务器：200正常Server: 200 OK `true`： is `true`: 客户端：获取 someUrlClient: GET someUrl 服务器： 401 WWW-身份验证基本Server: 401 WWW-Authenticate Basic 客户端：获取授权标头Client: GET with Authorization headers 服务器：200正常Server: 200 OK 客户端：获取具有授权标头的 someUrlClient: GET someUrl with Authorization headers 如果身份验证方案不支持预身份验证，则忽略此属性的值。If the authentication scheme does not support preauthentication, the value of this property is ignored.

summary.span: 获取或设置请求的代理信息。

span.span: Gets or sets proxy information for the request.

value.span: 用于代理请求的 对象。

span.span: The object to use to proxy the request.

value.span: 默认值通过调用 属性设置。

span.span: The default value is set by calling the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性标识用于处理对 Internet 资源的请求的 对象。The property identifies the object to use to process requests to Internet resources. 若要指定不应使用代理，请将 属性设置为 方法返回的代理实例。To specify that no proxy should be used, set the property to the proxy instance returned by the method. 本地计算机或应用程序配置文件可以指定使用默认代理。The local computer or application config file may specify that a default proxy be used. 如果指定 属性，则 属性中的代理设置将覆盖本地计算机或应用程序配置文件， 实例将使用指定的代理设置。If the property is specified, then the proxy settings from the property override the local computer or application config file and the instance will use the proxy settings specified. 如果未在配置文件中指定代理，并且未指定 属性，则 类将使用从本地计算机上的 Internet Explorer 继承的代理设置。If no proxy is specified in a config file and the property is unspecified, the class uses the proxy settings inherited from Internet Explorer on the local computer. 如果 Internet Explorer 中没有代理设置，请求将直接发送到服务器。If there are no proxy settings in Internet Explorer, the request is sent directly to the server. 类分析代理绕过列表，其中通配符字符从 Internet Explorer 继承，与绕过列表直接由 Internet Explorer 分析。The class parses a proxy bypass list with wildcard characters inherited from Internet Explorer the same as the bypass list is parsed directly by Internet Explorer. 例如， 类会将 Internet Explorer 中的 "nt \*" 跳过列表分析为 "nt.\*" 的正则表达式。For example, the class will parse a bypass list of "nt\*" from Internet Explorer as a regular expression of "nt.\*". 因此，URL "`http://nt.com`" 会绕过代理使用 类和使用 Internet Explorer。So a URL of "`http://nt.com`" would bypass the proxy using the class and using Internet Explorer. 类支持本地代理跳过。The class supports local proxy bypass. 如果满足以下任一条件，则类将目标视为本地：The class considers a destination to be local if any of the following conditions are met: - 目标包含平面名称（URL 中没有点）。The destination contains a flat name (no dots in the URL). - 目标包含环回地址（ 或 ），或者目标包含分配给本地计算机的 。The destination contains a loopback address ( or ) or the destination contains an assigned to the local computer. - 目标的域后缀与本地计算机的域后缀（）匹配。The domain suffix of the destination matches the local computer's domain suffix (). 通过调用 、、或 方法启动请求后，更改 属性会引发 。Changing the property after the request has been started by calling the , , , or method throws an . 有关 proxy 元素的信息，请参阅[\< defaultProxy\>元素（网络设置）](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/defaultproxy-element-network-settings.md)。For information on the proxy element see [\<defaultProxy\> Element (Network Settings)](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/defaultproxy-element-network-settings.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 方法获取请求的代理信息。The following code example uses the method to get the proxy information for the request. [!code-cpp[Httpwebrequest_proxy#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Httpwebrequest_proxy/CPP/httpwebrequest_proxy.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Httpwebrequest_proxy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Httpwebrequest_proxy/CS/httpwebrequest_proxy.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Httpwebrequest_proxy#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Httpwebrequest_proxy/VB/httpwebrequest_proxy.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是使用 方法发出的后续同步请求等待响应的毫秒数， 方法将等待流。 is the number of milliseconds that a subsequent synchronous request made with the method waits for a response, and the method waits for a stream. 适用于整个请求和响应，而不是单独到 和 方法调用。The applies to the entire request and response, not individually to the and method calls. 如果未在超时期限内返回资源，则请求会引发 ，并将 属性设置为 ""。If the resource is not returned within the time-out period, the request throws a with the property set to . 属性必须在调用 或 方法之前设置。The property must be set before the or method is called. 调用 或 方法后更改 属性不起作用Changing the property after calling the or method has no effect 属性对通过 或 方法发出的异步请求不起作用。The property has no effect on asynchronous requests made with the or method. > [!CAUTION] > 对于异步请求，客户端应用程序实现其自己的超时机制。In the case of asynchronous requests, the client application implements its own time-out mechanism. 请参阅 方法中的示例。Refer to the example in the method. 若要指定在读或写操作超时之前要等待的时间量，请使用 属性。To specify the amount of time to wait before a read or write operation times out, use the property. 域名系统（DNS）查询可能需要长达15秒钟的时间来返回或超时。如果你的请求中包含需要解析的主机名，并且你将 设置为小于15秒的值，则可能需要15秒或更长时间，然后才会引发 来指示请求超时。A Domain Name System (DNS) query may take up to 15 seconds to return or time out. If your request contains a host name that requires resolution and you set to a value less than 15 seconds, it may take 15 seconds or more before a is thrown to indicate a timeout on your request. ## Examples 下面的代码示例设置 对象的 属性。The following code example sets the property of the object. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否允许经过高速 NTLM 身份验证的连接共享。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to allow high-speed NTLM-authenticated connection sharing.

value.span: 表示使经过身份验证的连接保持打开状态；否则为 。

span.span: to keep the authenticated connection open; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性的默认值为 `false`，这将导致在请求完成后关闭当前连接。The default value for this property is `false`, which causes the current connection to be closed after a request is completed. 每次发出新请求时，应用程序都必须经过身份验证顺序。Your application must go through the authentication sequence every time it issues a new request. 如果将此属性设置为 `true`，则在执行身份验证后，用于检索响应的连接将保持打开状态。If this property is set to `true`, the connection used to retrieve the response remains open after the authentication has been performed. 在这种情况下，将该属性设置为 `true` 的其他请求可能会使用该连接，而无需重新进行身份验证。In this case, other requests that have this property set to `true` may use the connection without re-authenticating. 换句话说，如果连接已通过用户 A 的身份验证，则用户 B 可以重复使用 A 的连接;用户 B 的请求是根据用户 A 的凭据完成的。In other words, if a connection has been authenticated for user A, user B may reuse A's connection; user B's request is fulfilled based on the credentials of user A. > [!CAUTION] > 由于应用程序在未经身份验证的情况下可以使用连接，因此，在将此属性设置为 `true`时，需要确保系统中不存在任何管理漏洞。Because it is possible for an application to use the connection without being authenticated, you need to be sure that there is no administrative vulnerability in your system when setting this property to `true`. 如果你的应用程序为多个用户发送请求（模拟多个用户帐户）并依赖身份验证来保护资源，则不要将此属性设置为 `true` 除非你按如下所述使用连接组。If your application sends requests for multiple users (impersonates multiple user accounts) and relies on authentication to protect resources, do not set this property to `true` unless you use connection groups as described below. 如果遇到性能问题，并且应用程序在使用集成 Windows 身份验证的 Web 服务器上运行，则可能需要考虑启用此机制。You may want to consider enabling this mechanism if your are having performance problems and your application is running on a Web server with integrated Windows authentication. 启用此设置可打开系统安全风险。Enabling this setting opens the system to security risks. 如果将 属性设置为 `true` 请确保采取以下预防措施：If you set the property to `true` be sure to take the following precautions: - 使用 属性可管理不同用户的连接。Use the property to manage connections for different users. 这样就避免了未经身份验证的应用程序可能使用连接。This avoids the potential use of the connection by non-authenticated applications. 例如，用户 A 应具有不同于用户 B 的唯一连接组名称。这为每个用户帐户提供了一个隔离层。For example, user A should have a unique connection group name that is different from user B. This provides a layer of isolation for each user account. - 在受保护的环境中运行你的应用程序，以帮助避免可能的连接攻击。Run your application in a protected environment to help avoid possible connection exploits. 如果你控制后端服务器，你可以考虑禁用身份验证持久性。If you control the back-end server, as an alternative you might consider turning off authentication persistence. 这会提高性能，但性能更高。This increases performance to a lesser degree, but it is safer. 有关更多详细信息，请[https://msdn.microsoft.com/library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library)上的 MSDN library 中搜索 "AuthPersistence"。For more details, search for AuthPersistence in the MSDN library at [https://msdn.microsoft.com/library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library). > [!NOTE] > 如果 和 均设置为 `true`，则每个请求都使用来自 unsafe 池的连接发送，但使用授权标头。If both and are set to `true`, each request is sent using a connection from the unsafe pool, but with an Authorization header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将此属性设置为 `true` 当此 对象发出的请求应在服务器请求时使用当前登录用户的凭据进行身份验证。Set this property to `true` when requests made by this object should, if requested by the server, be authenticated using the credentials of the currently logged on user. 对于客户端应用程序，这在大多数情况下都是所需的行为。For client applications, this is the desired behavior in most scenarios. 对于中间层应用程序（如 ASP.NET 应用程序），通常会将 属性设置为代表其发出请求的客户端的凭据。For middle-tier applications, such as ASP.NET applications, instead of using this property, you would typically set the property to the credentials of the client on whose behalf the request is made.
